metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9817 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Images from a different domain can be read using a canvas object in somecircumstances. This could be used to steal image data from a different sitein violation of same-origin policy. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird< 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9817` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
